Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence to support the claim that the Gates Foundation is spending billions to ensure that all medical and dental injections and procedures include tracking microchips.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the fear that a large number of people will refuse the COVID-19 vaccine because it will include tracking microchips. There is no evidence to support this fear.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the statement that the Gates Foundation is spending billions on including tracking microchips in medical and dental procedures.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a scheme to microchip people through medical and dental procedures, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations and evidence provided by experts that debunk the idea of microchipping through vaccines or medical procedures.
